chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Latonia R Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order [Modifiers: Extend Order for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
OWI COURT SENTENCE
A withheld sentence, eighteen (18) months probation and mandatory minimum jail as a condition of probation. Entrance into and completion of the OWI Court program as a condition of probation.

miscConds.notes: $1200.00 fine, with all but minimum ($600) stayed, plus costs.
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Defendant must enter into and successfully complete the Walworth County OWI Court Program and comply with all rules, recommendations, requirements, and fees of the program.  

Defendant MUST follow all OWI Court Program, Jail and Probation rules with no violations. Any violation of rules or failure to adhere to treatment requirements could mean removal from the OWI Court Program, revocation of probation, and an immediate imposition of the remaining jail sentence. Such sentence MUST be served within the Walworth County Huber Facility.
Mandatory attendance at Victim Impact Panel.

timeConds.notes: Thirty (30) days initial mandatory minimum jail sentence is to be completed at the Walworth County Jail Huber facility to commence FORTHWITH. This conditional jail time may be served on electronic monitoring at the discretion of the Walworth County Jail

supervisions.notes: Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
2:11 PM Defendant Latonia R Pearson in court.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Latonia R Pearson. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to all four counts contained in Information.
Defendant acknowledges three prior convictions.
Court has colloquy with defendant.
Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, and ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored.
Attorney Selmek believes pleas to be made freely, knowingly, and voluntarily.
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. 
Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Crawford.
Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Selmek.
Defendant addresses the Court.
Court goes over sentencing factors.

Count 1 - Court will WITHHOLD SENTENCE and place the defendant on Probation for a period of eighteen (18) months with the mandatory minimum jail sentence as a condition of probation. Defendant's entrance into and completion of the OWI Court program will be a condition of probation.  

Thirty (30) days initial mandatory minimum jail sentence is to be completed at the Walworth County Jail Huber facility to commence FORTHWITH.  This conditional jail time may be served on electronic monitoring at the discretion of the Walworth County Jail. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

Defendant MUST follow all OWI Court Program,  Jail, and Probation rules with no violations. Any violation of rules or failure to adhere to treatment requirements could mean removal from the OWI Court Program, revocation of probation, and an immediate imposition of a jail sentence.  Such sentence MUST be served within the Walworth County Huber facility. 

$1200 fine, with all but minimum ($600) stayed, plus costs. 

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant must attend a Victim Impact Panel. 

Lifetime revocation of drivers license.

Minimum length of vehicle interlock device installation for a period of 24 months. 

Defendant must read and sign the Consent for Disclose of Confidential Treatment Information and the participant waiver and agreement. 

Conditions of participation will include drug/alcohol screens and complete, meaningful compliance with ALL treatment programming and attendance at OWI court sessions.  This includes a requirement of no alcohol or drug use. 

Count 2 - No additional sentence.

Count 3 - Pay $150 fine plus costs.  DNA sample and surcharge.

Count 4 - Pay $150 fine plus costs.  Six (6) month extension of IID requirement.  DNA sample and surcharge.
Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Comply with any IID Orders.

Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Latonia R Pearson appeared in court, Attorney Leah Selmek appeared in court for Latonia R Pearson. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Minutes filed.
Arraignment scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
